resources.string: Standard rules of chess (FIDE)
Custom starting position
Lose all your pieces (or get stalemated) to win
Nuke your opponent's king to win
Starting position of the home rank pieces is randomized
Captured pieces can be dropped back on the board instead of moving a piece
Check your opponent 5 times to win
Destroy the horde to win
Bring your King to the center to win
Standard chess but no castling
Race your King to the eighth rank to win
Check your opponent 3 times to win
Connect all of your checkers to win
Connect all of your scrambled checkers to win
Standard rules of international draughts (FMJD)
Custom starting position
Lose all your pieces (or run out of moves) to win
Same rules as international draughts, played on an 8x8 board
The first player who makes a king wins
Pieces can also capture horizontally and vertically
Frisian draughts starting with 5 pieces each
The same rules as Russian Draughts, but with no promotion during a capture chain
Choice of capture, promotion during a multi-capture
Similar rules to Brazilian, but men cant jump backwards
English draughts, also known as American checkers. Men cannot jump backwards, and Kings are not flying
Shogi (Japanese Chess)
Xiangqi (Chinese Chess)
Mini Shogi (Japanese Chess on a smaller board)
Mini Xiangqi (Chinese Chess on a smaller board)
Flip pieces between your color to get the most board area
Flip pieces between your color to get the most board area
Immobilize all the enemy pieces
Capture the most stones to win
Capture the most stones to win
Surround the largest area(s) of the 9 by 9 board with your stones to win
Surround the largest area(s) of the 13 by 13 board with your stones to win
Surround the largest area(s) of the 19 by 19 board with your stones to win
